hints.content:
There are $\blueD{8}$ chefs.

The made $\greenD{56}$ total meals.

[[☃ image 1]]

What is the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$?

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of equal lengths. The first tape is labeled 56 and the second tape with 8 equal parts each labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the second tape is labeled with the words 8 equal groups. !

hints.content:
We can write this as a multiplication problem. 

$\blueD{\text{ number of groups}}\times\purpleC{\text{size of the group}}= \greenD{\text{ total}}$

So, $\blueD{8}\times\purpleC{\text{?}} = \greenD{56}$

We can also write this as a division problem. 

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\blueD{\text{ number of groups}}=\purpleC{\text{ size of the groups}}$

So, $\greenD{56}\div \blueD{8}=\purpleC{\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many meals each chef made are:

 - $\blueD{8}\times\purpleC{\text{?}} = \greenD{56}$
 - $\greenD{56}\div \blueD{8}=\purpleC{\text{?}}$

question.content:
There are $8$ chefs. They made $56$ total meals. Each chef made the same number of meals.

**Which equations would help us find out how many meals each chef made?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
